abstract: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are among the members of a secretive club that holds the keys to essentially running the lucrative derivatives market.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are among the members of a secretive club that holds the keys to essentially running the lucrative derivatives market.
lead_paragraph: On the third Wednesday of every month, the nine members of an elite Wall Street society gather in Midtown Manhattan, Louise Story reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: A Secretive Banking Elite Rules Trading in Derivatives

abstract: The Obama bill may be a “double whammy” for the tax-free bonds, deterring investors and dampening prices.
snippet: The Obama bill may be a “double whammy” for the tax-free bonds, deterring investors and dampening prices.
lead_paragraph: Investors are fast losing trust in the municipal bond market — a situation that may be exacerbated by the tax bill wending its way through Congress.
